subject: statistics
title: F-Tests: Comparing Variances
contentHtml:
F-tests are a fundamental concept in statistical hypothesis testing, used to compare variances between groups.

Given two or more populations with unknown variances, F-tests help determine if the population variances are equal or not.
name: F-statistic
problemHtml: Suppose we want to compare the variance of exam scores between two teaching methods.
steps: [ {"stepNumber": 1, "description": "Calculate the sample variances", "mathHtml": "\[s_1^2 = \frac{\sum (x_i - \bar{x}_1)^2}{n-1}\]", "explanation": "Use the sample data to estimate the population variance"}, {"stepNumber": 2, "description": "Calculate the F-statistic", "mathHtml": "\[F = \frac{s_1^2}{s_0^2}\]", "explanation": "Divide the larger variance by the smaller one"} ],
intuition: F-tests provide a statistical way to determine if the differences between group variances are significant, helping us reject or fail to reject the null hypothesis.
